snippet: The deposed leader remains confined to a hospital room in Cairo even as many former allies cut deals with the government to overturn their own convictions.
abstract: Former Egyptian President Hosni Mubarak has yet to be released from confinement at Cairo hospital room, which has doubled as jail cell for three years, despite judge’s decree in 2015 that he had completed his prison sentence for corruption; many of Mubarak's former allies, who grew rich during his three decades of rule, are cutting deals with government to overturn their own convictions.

byline.original: By DECLAN WALSH and NOUR YOUSSEF

lead_paragraph: The deposed leader remains confined to a hospital room in Cairo even as many former allies cut deals with the government to overturn their own convictions.

headline.main: The Strange, Unending Limbo of Egypt’s Hosni Mubarak
headline.print_headline: In Limbo, Mubarak Goes Along to Get Along
